meanings.sent1: The starchier fabric felt rough against her skin.
meanings.sent2: The potatoes were starchier than usual, making them perfect for frying.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his starchier shirt could stand up on its own.
meanings.sent4: The air in the room felt starchier than usual, as if it had been thickened.
meanings.sent5: The starchier texture of the paper made it easier to fold into origami shapes.

meanings.sent1: The starchier vegetables took longer to cook.
meanings.sent2: The bread was starchier than expected, but still delicious.
meanings.sent3: She found it amusing that the starchier rice absorbed more water.
meanings.sent4: The starchier soil yielded healthier plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The starchier pasta held the sauce better, creating a more flavorful dish.

meanings.definition: Tending to be stiff or formal in manner.
meanings.sent1: His starchier demeanor softened when he smiled.
meanings.sent2: The starchier tone of the meeting made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: She playfully teased him about his starchier attitude at the party.
meanings.sent4: The starchier atmosphere in the office lightened after the team bonding activity.
meanings.sent5: The starchier rules at the school made it difficult for students to express themselves freely.
